intro: Medicago pugionata, commonly known as the sickle vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, trifoliate leaves with a distinctive sickle-shaped leaflet. Its flowers are yellow and appear in racemes, contributing to its ornamental value. Medicago pugionata is often found in disturbed soils and is used in some regions for forage or as a cover crop.
